intro: Valerianella radiata var. intermedia, commonly known as Italian parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often used as a culinary herb. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in cool climates and is often cultivated for its aromatic foliage and edible qualities. The leaves contain volatile oils that contribute to its distinctive flavor and aroma.
